## Expectation.toHaveBeenCalledWith() method

Check if the mock has been called with the provided arguments.

You can use matchers in place of a value. When a matcher is encountered its internal rules are used instead of the usual checks.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
toHaveBeenCalledWith(this: Expectation<Mock<any[], any>>, args: MockArgs<T>): void;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  this | [Expectation](./earljs.expectation.md)<!-- -->&lt;[Mock](./earljs.mock.md)<!-- -->&lt;any\[\], any&gt;&gt; |  |
|  args | MockArgs&lt;T&gt; | an array of values or matchers to check the mock calls against. |

<b>Returns:</b>

void
